meanings.definition: One who skirts or avoids something.
meanings.sent1: The skirter quickly dodged the puddle on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: The skirter always finds a way to avoid confrontations.
meanings.sent3: The skirter skillfully sidestepped the awkward conversation.
meanings.sent4: She was a master skirter, effortlessly evading any difficult situation.
meanings.sent5: The skirter's ability to avoid trouble was truly impressive.

meanings.definition: A garment that hangs from the waist and covers the lower part of the body.
meanings.sent1: She wore a beautiful skirter to the party.
meanings.sent2: The skirter swayed gracefully as she walked.
meanings.sent3: The skirter's vibrant color brightened up the room.
meanings.sent4: Her skirter flowed like a gentle stream as she danced.
meanings.sent5: The skirter's fabric was soft to the touch.

meanings.definition: To move along the edge of something.
meanings.sent1: The cat likes to skirter around the garden fence.
meanings.sent2: She had to skirter carefully along the narrow path.
meanings.sent3: He decided to skirter around the issue instead of facing it head-on.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to skirter through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's feet skirtered gracefully across the stage.
